Posts.Content: Hi Sunflower76 . Thanks for posting this! I’m always amazed at how different and how similar we all can be.Ive had a similar journey to you and I’m 1 week post Rads. Side effects for me are minimal, nothing a bit of moisturiser cannot control .tamoxifen triggered the collywobbles in me as I have had migraines since a child and extremely sensitive to hormone changes! BUT I take it in evening and all is good; I’ve been on it for 2 months approx no side effects at all, which is brilliant. the more I read your post it kept thinking is this about how our experiences have totally shaken up our values and life goals? Having had  a cancer diagnosis can kind of wake you up and see things through new filters , it certainly changed me - we make seem the same to others but how can we be? May sound totally whacky but perhaps you are on the move girl! Maybe you have some ideas to chew over and give a go, exciting times ahead! ps stamp or slap any demons or suchlike under foot where they belong! As you may have new plans- you just didn’t realise until now! Love to you and everyone in treatment. Looking forward to walking with you xx
Posts.Title: Restless and feeling guilty about it

Posts.Content: Such great news OKS thanks for sharing your brilliant news!  ️ xx
Posts.Title: EC

Posts.Content: Morning susie39, welcome to this site that no one wanted to be part of - although it was one of the best things I did following diagnosis, approx’ a year ago. I also had stage one but initially who cares what stage right! It’s cancer. what you’re feeling is totally normal . I hate the way our minds conjure up the worse scenarios! Treatment for this evil critter is developing daily and is totally do- able. My treatment went without any hitches. Work wouldn’t have known because I had radiotherapy before shift and tamoxifen no huge problem. So you can do this, take it one day at a time, look after yourself, ask for support as needed .ive just had my first check up and all clear. I’m sure many will respond this is such an amazingly supportive group. All our journeys are different, so Ask anything, as one of us has probably experienced it too! warm hug and to you  X
Posts.Title: Stage one breast cancer.

Posts.Content: Hi Kate I’m also recently diagnosed. I’ve had my operation in last few weeks, the same that you are waiting for.I’m so fortunate to have had a surgeon who is totally hot off the press! I found waiting the biggest challenge. It really helped me to channel my thoughts toward hope and attend to one day at a time- try not to be hard on yourself, the diagnosis is a shock for us all- we can all stand together! I returned to work 2 days after opp ‘ a bit sore but ok, taking it easy and still doing some excercise, but totally not in your excercise league!  Haha! Take care
Posts.Title: New Here, diagnosed yesterday

Posts.Content: Hi OCRKate so sorry to hear this and if I was in your shoes I too would be by your side with buckets it’s totally normal to get it out! It may sound crackers to you but I’m thinking it’s so good this has been detected, so let’s get the little demons out before they play more nasty games!!  Standing with you . Your going to do this step by step with big  girl floral  pants   Xx
Posts.Title: New Here, diagnosed yesterday

Posts.Content: Great News Bluebell22!
Posts.Title: Fed Up!!

Posts.Content: Evening xjuliex ooo sorry that you’re sore. I had no 7 today over weekend boob and nipple sensitive but they seemed to sort them self out ok. I’m putting loads of cream on to soak in when I go to bed and gel immediately after zapping. Slight ache when put arm behind head but that’s it. Hope soreness eases with your cream and an airing. im off to bed early too! Sleep well everyone!  Xx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Hi anjeib  Ive also read about not applying cold packs but then have heard opposite. My consultant said just be sensible depending on your skin. if it helps do it and if it doesn’t stop it. I have been very blessed so far as skin only a slight pink after no 10. let us know what you find out today! Sending love over to all you beautiful women and handsome guys having RT ️ x
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Well done Moomc! totally understand how you feel about being  held, kind of a comfort knowing you are being closely monitored. i had no idea what was happening in my body and couldn’t feel anything even when they showed me where it was but we will have yearly checks. brilliant that you have minimal side effects let’s hope it stays that way and recovery is quick. Here’s to life and living it to the full everyone! Xx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Hi Panana my consultant said swimming was fine just rinse off chlorine and moisture. He said to monitor skin and act accordingly. Everyone reacts individually in their own way. Hope all goes well thinking of you tomorrow. Let’s DO THIS! xx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Hi Moomc  I start mine on July 9th and finish on 27th. I’m looking forward to it being over! I’m going to take it as it comes as Ive been told everyone potentially responds differently. I’ve got soon R1 and R2 gel and cream and will be keep fluids high so expecting lots of loo runs to keep me energised- well that’s what I’m thinking! How it all goes well for everyone! X
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Hi Moomc I had no 2 today much quicker, as you say and also I was more organised with changing, check in etc. I have a consultant appointment added to end of each week, but no physio or skin- these areas were covered with other appointments before start of RT.  I am south to you, so as you say area and I’m sure individual treatment may make a difference. hoping that your treatment all goes to plan . Take good care of yourself- That goes for everyone! Xx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Hope all goes well for you tomorrow your first zap! xx  hugs
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Hey thanks xjuliex ! im off on holiday Monday so just in case I miss u..... whoop whoop! ️ you did it sending hugs and love to you, and everyone that wants some morexx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Hi Claire so pleased to hear r1+2 was good. How did you get on with allowing 20 minutes for gel to soak after treatment , how did you do that part? I was guessing that they assume we will be without clothing for 20!!  I’m a bit concerned the gel will be slipping down my arms in this heat while I’m at work! Xx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Xjuliex Just waiting  in waiting room for my gel to sink in after zap and read your post  could imagine you pouring water over yourself made me smile!  Hope your skin is calmer now! yes gentle hugs my boob was squished yesterday which made me yelp!! Xx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Sure did ring that bell! se ning love to all of us going through this together xx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Hi I had 13th today so two more left hurray! The staff are amazing always willing to offer support in every way. The waiting room is a hub for surprises, laughs, educational,and support, to be truthful I’ll miss it! i have been so fortunate with regard to side effects I just have a pinkish square over breast which isn’t sore and my tamoxifen hasn’t given me any flushes etc so totally send love and cheer to those having a hard time!  Thankfully everyday is moving us forward. keep chilled everyone, I’ve just got some aloe era gel for fridge just in preparation for any sore skin from accumulative nature of RT.  Xx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Hi Yme, thanks , I rang the  whoo whoo! Just thought those two bells looked a bit like my boobs with nipples  sticking out! I was given the leaving letter with the expectation that things will get worse,  but will just take it day by day. I’m going to start focussing a bit more on me from now on, it’s all a bit of a wakeup call isn’t it. So great that RT is behind me now and mornings won’t be starting so very early. I was thinking of having a full scan as an mot , I’ve learnt that it’s better to catch anything earl, I’m not going to let any cancer gremlins have a tea party in my body if I can help it! ️ I hope your aching improves on the double!  Lets hope for rain and some cool weather to cool the rad boobs   sending love and hugs to one and all - gentle ones of course!  Xx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Morning. I’m fairly new too and I know that waiting is food for the thoughts! I would encourage you to focus as much as you can on your lovely holiday and enjoy. No amount of thinking will change anything except your happiness, have fun, see the sights and chill. You’ll hear whatever is to be told in time- after holiday fun. We are all standing with you
Posts.Title: Awaiting biopsy results and have had appointment letter .

Posts.Content: Go girl!
Posts.Title: Awaiting biopsy results and have had appointment letter .

Posts.Content: Go girl!
Posts.Title: Awaiting biopsy results and have had appointment letter .

Posts.Content: Morning. I’m fairly new too and I know that waiting is food for the thoughts! I would encourage you to focus as much as you can on your lovely holiday and enjoy. No amount of thinking will change anything except your happiness, have fun, see the sights and chill. You’ll hear whatever is to be told in time- after holiday fun. We are all standing with you
Posts.Title: Awaiting biopsy results and have had appointment letter .

Posts.Content: Hi my surgeon and consultant oncologist knows I’m going to OZ  USA  on tamoxifen I’ve got flight socks and arm with mit stocking they said have a lovely time going to drink fluids walk around etc I’m allergic to aspirin so can’t take it. no one suggested not a good idea or it would have been cancelled.   I guess all things are possible. Pharmacist may be good to ask they know medication interactions etc I’m going to ask mine xx
Posts.Title: Flying while on tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Sending love and hugs to you Dizzy17.crikey what a challenge for you but sounds like you cracked it big time well done!  So great to hear that you have family supporting you X
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Hi primrose I’m booked in for 13 th and want to start ASAP as holidays booked. Is there a list of creams to get in preparation of any changes to skin if it dares to happen!! :0)
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ June 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Primrose  So great they can be flexible. I just haven’t got time for nastys in my body, they just need to get out and stay out as like you I’ve made plans!! I’m going to look into alternatives for coffee and tea because I want to work with my body against these gremlins getting a hold in the future . So any ideas for pretend coffee and tea anyone and I’m all ears! ☕️
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ June 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hey young and fit thanks for that I’ll do it, dreading the coffee and tea cut but hey we have other stuff to focus on
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ June 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hey youngandfit so pleased 4 u! I’m starting RT in 3 weeks. I was asking specialist about swimming he said no to chlorinated pool but totally yes to the sea! So good to be able to excercise as long as ok. So good to read you post!
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ June 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Julia, great to hear that your GP is so willing as it costs a lot  perhaps ask your pharmacist to look it up. I don’t know any other names for it sorry it’s  R1 and R2 on the boxes  xx
Posts.Title: Everything and the Big C

Posts.Content: Hi yes different creams suggested to me also, it will all be your choice in the end, depending on how you respond, skin type etc.....why not give them a go now and see how they feel?  Hugs to you xx
Posts.Title: Everything and the Big C

Posts.Content: Hi   i asked my GP to prescribe a R1 & R2 a new ish Dutch cream. At times when I forgot it I used what my consultant suggested which was e45, it was great! the R1 for immediate after treatment and R2 through rest of day- as recommended - you’ll get to know as we are all unique gorgeous individuals we all may respond differently or not.  I chilled, looked after myself and meditated on all good things pleased I could help  you totally can do this  ️ xx
Posts.Title: Everything and the Big C

Posts.Content: Whoah, great news! So so pleased for you ️ my radiotherapy was totally fine I went daily before work, no one could tell until I shared with a few. I made sure I got my sleep, moisturised the area well and drink lots of fluids. I was very woried initially about tamoxifen as one side effect may be headaches and ive always had horrendous migraines! But I started to take it at 8pm daily and so far 3 months I do not think it has really effected me..... which is a total miracle I think! So although I totally understand your anxiety do try if you can to take your days as they come- your results were brilliant!! Step by step and huge hugs to you xx
Posts.Title: Everything and the Big C

Posts.Content: Chloecat45 juat wanted to forward a huge hug for you ️
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: Hi Taralou crikey how frustrating! I’m on my second week, but there was one day when it seemed that several of us couldn’t be lined up for a while. I’m not sure if one did not have it in the end. I’m guessing there could be lots of reasons , but in the end even though it’s frustrating I’ll rather not have it if I’m getting zapped in the wrong place. Today I felt totally in the wrong place and said but they confirmed it was ok. !  You are totally right about paracetamol it certainly isn’t a tranquilliser ! But having less pain makes sense you may be less tense in your muscles?? hope tomorrow all goes to plan the daily trips are tiring Take care x
Posts.Title: Not 'lined up' No RT today - anyone else have this?

Posts.Content: Hi Londongurl  i take tamoxifen and had many of the fears about taking it as you . I discussed it with my consultant and he suggested taking it at night. I’m very sensitive to hormone changes, my skin changed so much , hair thinned out and  fell out frequently but I haven’t had chemo, migraines for years, pounds pile on with medications ... But the good news is after taking tamoxifen for over a month I haven’t experienced any obvious side effect which I am soooooo so pleased with. I’ve been fitted with compression sleeve and socks for flights too as a protective factor for flights.  Im holding a stand against any cancer gremlins they have no right to be in our bodies! whatever you decide we will be here for you.  Xx
Posts.Title: Refusing Tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Hi Cazza1234 So sorry to see you on this site and so pleased that you have reached out for support. This group has been priceless, people who understand all our experiences no matter what we are going through. Sending you hugs. This waiting time at the beginning for all seems to be the most difficult because our thoughts can create the most crazy scenarios .my boys are in their early 20’s and my thoughts went straight to them when I was diagnosed.and at the same time my heart goes out to you with little ones. As already said take one step at a time and try to take time to care for yourself
Posts.Title: Not sure what I’m doing

Posts.Content: I saw this today and thought of us all
Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: X
Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: Love this one!
Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: Hi Sammystaff, yep, I think my head may have some spinning after an appointment with my Consultant if he wasn’t sure . But what did come to mind was that it’s good that you have been monitored and the alien has been spotted; also that your Consultant is seeking advice from others who I’m guessing have more knowledge in this specific situation- but in the meantime you’re waiting and that is such a challenge! So good that you have got it out and shared so that we can stand with and support you. There is always someone on this site who  have had similar experiences, so you are not alone - we are all on this journey together, so sending a hug   X
Posts.Title: Modules on the lung
